intro: Acrostichum plumieri, commonly known as the broadleaf hibiscus, is a tropical plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, waxy, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. It produces showy yellow flowers with red stamens, which bloom during the wet season. Acrostichum plumieri is often found in moist, shaded environments such as swamps and along riverbanks.
